segment.source: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image as Part of a Recovery Partition
segment.target: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image as Part of a Recovery Partition

segment.source: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image as Part of a Recovery Partition
segment.target: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image as Part of a Recovery Partition

segment.source: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image as Part of a Recovery Partition
segment.target: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image as Part of a Recovery Partition

segment.source: After you have finished running the Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 8.0 Recovery Image wizard and created the recovery image, you can extract the boot.wim file from the ISO image file and deploy it as a recovery partition in a Windows 8 image.
segment.target: After you have finished running the Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 8.0 Recovery Image wizard and created the recovery image, you can extract the boot.wim file from the ISO image file and deploy it as a recovery partition in a Windows 8 image.

segment.source: A partition is recommended, because any corruption issues that prevent the Windows operating system from starting would also prevent the recovery image from starting.
segment.target: A partition is recommended, because any corruption issues that prevent the Windows operating system from starting would also prevent the recovery image from starting.

segment.source: A separate partition also eliminates the need to provide the BitLocker recovery key twice.
segment.target: A separate partition also eliminates the need to provide the BitLocker recovery key twice.

segment.source: Consider hiding the partition to prevent users from storing files on it.
segment.target: Consider hiding the partition to prevent users from storing files on it.

segment.source: To deploy DaRT in the recovery partition of a Windows 8 image
segment.target: To deploy DaRT in the recovery partition of a Windows 8 image

segment.source: Create a target partition in your Windows 8 image that is equal to or greater than the size of the ISO image file that you created by using the DaRT 8.0 Recovery Image wizard.
segment.target: Create a target partition in your Windows 8 image that is equal to or greater than the size of the ISO image file that you created by using the DaRT 8.0 Recovery Image wizard.

segment.source: The minimum size required for a DaRT partition is 500MB to accommodate the remote connection functionality in DaRT.
segment.target: The minimum size required for a DaRT partition is 500MB to accommodate the remote connection functionality in DaRT.

segment.source: Extract the boot.wim file from the DaRT ISO image file.
segment.target: Extract the boot.wim file from the DaRT ISO image file.

segment.source: Using your company’s preferred method, mount the ISO image file that you created on the Create Startup Image page.
segment.target: Using your company’s preferred method, mount the ISO image file that you created on the Create Startup Image page.

segment.source: Open the ISO image file and copy the boot.wim file from the sources folder in the mounted image to a location on your computer or on an external drive.
segment.target: Open the ISO image file and copy the boot.wim file from the sources folder in the mounted image to a location on your computer or on an external drive.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you burned a CD, DVD, or USB of the recovery image, you can open the files on the removable media and copy the boot.wim file from the sources folder.
segment.target: If you burned a CD, DVD, or USB of the recovery image, you can open the files on the removable media and copy the boot.wim file from the sources folder.

segment.source: If you copy boot.wim file, you don’t need to mount the image.
segment.target: If you copy boot.wim file, you don’t need to mount the image.

segment.source: Use the boot.wim file to create a bootable recovery partition by using your company’s standard method for creating a custom Windows RE image.
segment.target: Use the boot.wim file to create a bootable recovery partition by using your company’s standard method for creating a custom Windows RE image.

segment.source: For more information about how to create or customize a recovery partition, see Customizing the Windows RE Experience.
segment.target: For more information about how to create or customize a recovery partition, see Customizing the Windows RE Experience.

segment.source: Replace the target partition in your Windows 8 image with the recovery partition.
segment.target: Replace the target partition in your Windows 8 image with the recovery partition.

segment.source: For more information about how to deploy a recovery solution to reinstall the factory image in the event of a system failure, see Deploy a System Recovery Image.
segment.target: For more information about how to deploy a recovery solution to reinstall the factory image in the event of a system failure, see Deploy a System Recovery Image.
